item.title: Writing an API Wrapper in Elixir With HTTPoison
item.description: As developers, we often have to interface with third-party APIs. This is no different when writing Elixir apps. Rather than pulling in some third-party library that’s specific to the API, I prefer to use HTTPoison to give me the minimal amount of functionality to write my own wrapper. I prefer to own the API implementation for a few reasons: Only the paths that are used are brought in, alleviating excess code from API implementation that isn’t used.
